channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Should the U.S. model its vaccine policy on Denmark's? Experts say we're nothing alike
item.description: The Trump administration wants to revamp U.S. childhood vaccination recommendations to align with some other peer nations, including one tiny country ...

item.title: U.S. strikes ISIS in Nigeria. And, holiday shopping was higher than expected
item.description: The U.S. has launched a "deadly strike" against Islamic State fighters in northwest Nigeria, according to Trump. And, holiday spending was higher than...

item.title: The cultural works becoming public domain in 2026, from Betty Boop to Nancy Drew
item.description: The original Betty Boop, the first four Nancy Drew books and Greta Garbo's first talkie are among the many works from 1930 that will be free to use, s...

item.title: Marijuana rescheduling would bring some immediate changes, but others will take time
item.description: President Trump set the process in motion to ease federal restrictions on marijuana. But his order doesn't automatically revoke laws targeting marijua...

item.title: Top Instagram reels from Goats and Soda in 2025: Plumpy'Nut, aid cuts, soccer grannies
item.description: Our most-viewed Instagram videos include reports from a Rhode Island factory that makes special food for malnourished children and from a tournament f...

item.title: Ex-Malaysia PM Najib Razak given 15-year jail term over state funds scandal
item.description: Najib was convicted for his role in the billion-dollar scandal involving the country's sovereign wealth fund 1MDB.

item.title: Zelensky plans to meet Trump on Sunday for talks on ending Russian war
item.description: The Ukrainian leader says he will see the US president in Florida and believes "a lot can be decided before the new year".

item.title: 8 killed, 18 wounded in mosque bombing in Syria
item.description: Images shared by Syria's state-run news agency showed blood on carpets, holes in the walls, shattered windows and fire damage.

item.title: Zelenskyy says he will meet Trump on Sunday for Ukraine-Russia talks
item.description: Ukrainian President Zelenskyy says he and President Trump have agreed to meet in Florida on Sunday, signaling progress in talks to end the Russia-Ukra...

item.title: Two killed in suspected Palestinian ramming and knife attack in Israel
item.description: Police say the attacker, from the occupied West Bank, ran over at least one person before stabbing another victim several miles away.

item.title: Veterans Affairs Department reimposing near total abortion ban
item.description: The Veterans Affairs Department is reimposing a near total ban on abortions for veterans and their families that was modified in 2022.

item.title: US launches strikes against Islamic State in Nigeria
item.description: President Trump has previously accused the Nigerian government of failing to protect Christians from jihadists.

item.title: Blast at Syrian mosque during Friday prayers leaves at least eight dead

item.title: Gold IRA vs. silver IRA: Which will be better for investors in 2026?
item.description: Gold and silver prices are soaring, which could bode well for both types of IRAs, but one may be the better option.

item.title: Maps show winter storm forecast for ice and snow from Great Lakes to Northeast
item.description: Millions of Americans live in areas under winter storm alerts stretching from northern Minnesota to the Eastern Seaboard.

item.title: Public release of Epstein records puts Maxwell under fresh scrutiny amid her claims of innocence

item.title: Virtual reality opens doors for older people to build closer connections in real life
New storm hitting waterlogged Southern California could bring mudslides and high surf
